edu.berkeley.atdp.java.game
Class GameObject

java.lang.Object
  edu.berkeley.atdp.java.game.GameObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
PongGame
public abstract class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

The entry point for games. It has an array of nonplayable characters, an array of playable characters, and a GamePanel which displays the state of the GameObject to the user.

Author:
Jonathan Berney

Constructor Detail

GameObject

public GameObject()
Constructor that creates a new GameObject with default values for its fields. This constructor is used for sending dummy clones to GameLogic objects for evaluation.

GameObject

public GameObject(java.awt.Color background,
                  int width,
                  int height)
Constructor that creates a new GameObject, with several initializng parameters.

Parameters:
background - the background color of the GamePanel.
width - the initial width of the JFrame.
height - the initial height of the JFrame.
